intro: Calendula persica subsp. gracilis, commonly known as Persian marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves and showy capitula. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and herbal use. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as a natural dye.
